debug.description: Enable uptrends debug mode. Defaults to `false`.

password.description: Password for the uptrends API. Can be specified with the UPTRENDS_PASSWORD environment variable.

username.description: Username for the uptrends API. Can be specified with the UPTRENDS_USERNAME environment variable.

alert_on_load_time_limit_1.description: Set this value to true, if you want to receive alerts if your server response is slower than load_time_limit_1 threshold. Shows a yellow status in performance monitor. Defaults to `false`.

alert_on_load_time_limit_2.description: Set this value to true, if you want to receive alerts if your server response is slower than load_time_limit_2. Shows a red status in performance monitor. Defaults to `false`.

auth_type.description: Specify the username of the appropriate credentials here. Defaults to `None`.

cert_expiration_warning_days.description: Specify the expiration warning days of the certificate. Defaults to `7` days.

cert_fingerprint.description: Specify the fingerprint of the certificate. Defaults to empty string to not check this field.

cert_issuer_company_name.description: Specify the issuer company name of the certificate. Defaults to empty string to not check this field.

cert_issuer_name.description: Specify the issuer common name of the certificate. Defaults to empty string to not check this field.

cert_issuer_org_unit.description: Specify the issuer org unit of the certificate. Defaults to empty string to not check this field.

cert_name.description: Specify the common name of the certificate. Defaults to empty string to not check this field.

cert_org.description: Specify the organization of the certificate. Defaults to empty string to not check this field.

cert_org_unit.description: Specify the organizational unit of the certificate. Defaults to empty string to not check this field.

cert_serial_number.description: Specify the serial number of the certificate. Defaults to empty string to not check this field.

check_cert_errors.description: An HTTPS check will only pass our checks if the SSL certificate does not cause any errors. Only set this option to `false` if you really want to ignore SSL certificate issues. This parameter takes only effect if `type` has been set to `Https`.

check_interval.description: Numeric value for the time interval between individual checks, in minutes. The maximum value is 240 (4 hours). The minimum value depends on the type of monitor. Defaults to `5`.

generate_alert.description: When set to false, no alerts will be generated for this monitor in case of an error. Defaults to `true`.

ip_version.description: IpV4 or IpV6. Indicates which IP version should be used to connect to the server or network address you specify. If you choose IPv6, the monitor will only be executed on checkpoint locations that support IPv6. Defaults to `IpV4`.

is_active.description: Indicates whether the monitor is actively running in the account. Defaults to `true`.

is_locked.description: It specifies whether the monitor is currently locked for editing. This happens if the Support team is reviewing your monitor.

load_time_limit_1.description: Set threshold time in ms for requires `alert_on_load_time_limit_1` to be enabled. Defaults to `2500`.

load_time_limit_2.description: Set threshold time in ms for requires `alert_on_load_time_limit_2` to be enabled. Defaults to `5000`.

mode.description: The monitor mode, either Development, Staging or Production. Defaults to `Production`.

name.description: Display name for the Ping Monitor resource.

name_for_phone_alerts.description: The value for the speech-friendly monitor name, if applicable. This is the monitor name we’ll use in text-to-speech phone alerting, provided that the ‘Use alternate monitor names’ option has been enabled in the phone alert integration.

native_ipv6_only.description: True or False. This setting only applies when you select IpV6 for the IpVersion field. Set this value to true to only execute your monitor on checkpoint servers that support native IPv6 connectivity. Defaults to `false`.

password.description: See the Username field. Specify the corresponding password value here.

primary_checkpoints_only.description: Only set this to False when you’re sure you want to execute your monitor on non-primary checkpoints. Defaults to `true`.

url.description: The full URL of the appropriate website, page or service that you want to monitor. The URL should include “https://”, please also include a port number if you are using a non-default port number, e.g. https://your-domain.com:8080/your-page. You can also use a fixed IP address as part of the URL instead of a host name, if your server listens to incoming requests without a host name.

username.description: Specify the username of the appropriate credentials here.

checkpoints.description: A checkpoint is a geographic location from which you can have your service uptime and performance checked periodically. Provide checkpoint ids or names.

exclude_locations.description: It is possible to keep an entire region of checkpoints (e.g. Canada) selected (with the benefit of automatically getting new checkpoints as they are added to that region) but have additional control over individual checkpoint locations that you want to skip. Provide checkpoint ids or names.

regions.description: A Region contains one or more checkpoints, just define a region if all checkpoints in a region should be used. Provide region id or name.

block.description: Manages an Uptrends SSL Certificate Monitor.

alert_on_load_time_limit_1.description: Set this value to true, if you want to receive alerts if your server response is slower than load_time_limit_1 threshold. Shows a yellow status in performance monitor. Defaults to `false`.

alert_on_load_time_limit_2.description: Set this value to true, if you want to receive alerts if your server response is slower than load_time_limit_2. Shows a red status in performance monitor. Defaults to `false`.

check_interval.description: Numeric value for the time interval between individual checks, in minutes. The maximum value is 240 (4 hours). The minimum value depends on the type of monitor. Defaults to `5`.

db_name.description: Optionally specify the name of the database you want to connect to.

generate_alert.description: When set to false, no alerts will be generated for this monitor in case of an error. Defaults to `true`.

ip_version.description: IpV4 or IpV6. Indicates which IP version should be used to connect to the server or network address you specify. If you choose IPv6, the monitor will only be executed on checkpoint locations that support IPv6. Defaults to `IpV4`.

is_active.description: Indicates whether the monitor is actively running in the account. Defaults to `true`.

is_locked.description: It specifies whether the monitor is currently locked for editing. This happens if the Support team is reviewing your monitor.

load_time_limit_2.description: Set threshold time in ms for requires `alert_on_load_time_limit_2` to be enabled. Defaults to `5000`.

mode.description: The monitor mode, either Development, Staging or Production. Defaults to `Production`.

name.description: Display name for the Ping Monitor resource.

name_for_phone_alerts.description: The value for the speech-friendly monitor name, if applicable. This is the monitor name we’ll use in text-to-speech phone alerting, provided that the ‘Use alternate monitor names’ option has been enabled in the phone alert integration.

native_ipv6_only.description: True or False. This setting only applies when you select IpV6 for the IpVersion field. Set this value to true to only execute your monitor on checkpoint servers that support native IPv6 connectivity. Defaults to `false`.

network_address.description: The network address that should be used to connect to the server or service you want to monitor.

password.description: See the Username field. Specify the corresponding password value here.

port.description: The TCP Port for the dns Monitor, has to be between `1` and `65535`. Defaults to `53`.

primary_checkpoints_only.description: Only set this to False when you’re sure you want to execute your monitor on non-primary checkpoints. Defaults to `true`.

type.description: Select between `MySQL` and `MSSQL` monitor type. Defaults to `MySQL`

username.description: Specify the username of the appropriate credentials here.

checkpoints.description: A checkpoint is a geographic location from which you can have your service uptime and performance checked periodically. Provide checkpoint ids or names.

exclude_locations.description: It is possible to keep an entire region of checkpoints (e.g. Canada) selected (with the benefit of automatically getting new checkpoints as they are added to that region) but have additional control over individual checkpoint locations that you want to skip. Provide checkpoint ids or names.

regions.description: A Region contains one or more checkpoints, just define a region if all checkpoints in a region should be used. Provide region id or name.

block.description: Manages an Uptrends Database Server Monitor.

alert_on_load_time_limit_1.description: Set this value to true, if you want to receive alerts if your server response is slower than load_time_limit_1 threshold. Shows a yellow status in performance monitor. Defaults to `false`.

alert_on_load_time_limit_2.description: Set this value to true, if you want to receive alerts if your server response is slower than load_time_limit_2. Shows a red status in performance monitor. Defaults to `false`.

check_interval.description: Numeric value for the time interval between individual checks, in minutes. The maximum value is 240 (4 hours). The minimum value depends on the type of monitor. Defaults to `5`.

dns_expected_result.description: The result you expect to get back from DNS query.

dns_query.description: The Type of DNS query you want to perform. Alloed values are `ARecord`, `CnameRecord`, `MxRecord`, `NsRecord`, `TxtRecord`, `SoaRecord`, `RootServer`, `AaaaRecord`, `SrvRecord`.

dns_server.description: The DNS Server that contains the entries you want to test.

dns_test_value.description: The value to test for e.g. example.com.

generate_alert.description: When set to false, no alerts will be generated for this monitor in case of an error. Defaults to `true`.

ip_version.description: IpV4 or IpV6. Indicates which IP version should be used to connect to the server or network address you specify. If you choose IPv6, the monitor will only be executed on checkpoint locations that support IPv6. Defaults to `IpV4`.

is_active.description: Indicates whether the monitor is actively running in the account. Defaults to `true`.

is_locked.description: It specifies whether the monitor is currently locked for editing. This happens if the Support team is reviewing your monitor.

load_time_limit_1.description: Set threshold time in ms for requires `alert_on_load_time_limit_1` to be enabled. Defaults to `2500`.

load_time_limit_2.description: Set threshold time in ms for requires `alert_on_load_time_limit_2` to be enabled. Defaults to `5000`.

mode.description: The monitor mode, either Development, Staging or Production. Defaults to `Production`.

name.description: Display name for the Ping Monitor resource.

name_for_phone_alerts.description: The value for the speech-friendly monitor name, if applicable. This is the monitor name we’ll use in text-to-speech phone alerting, provided that the ‘Use alternate monitor names’ option has been enabled in the phone alert integration.

native_ipv6_only.description: True or False. This setting only applies when you select IpV6 for the IpVersion field. Set this value to true to only execute your monitor on checkpoint servers that support native IPv6 connectivity. Defaults to `false`.

port.description: The TCP Port for the dns Monitor, has to be between `1` and `65535`. Defaults to `53`.

primary_checkpoints_only.description: Only set this to False when you’re sure you want to execute your monitor on non-primary checkpoints. Defaults to `true`.

checkpoints.description: A checkpoint is a geographic location from which you can have your service uptime and performance checked periodically. Provide checkpoint ids or names.

exclude_locations.description: It is possible to keep an entire region of checkpoints (e.g. Canada) selected (with the benefit of automatically getting new checkpoints as they are added to that region) but have additional control over individual checkpoint locations that you want to skip. Provide checkpoint ids or names.

regions.description: A Region contains one or more checkpoints, just define a region if all checkpoints in a region should be used. Provide region id or name.

alert_on_load_time_limit_1.description: Set this value to true, if you want to receive alerts if your server response is slower than load_time_limit_1 threshold. Shows a yellow status in performance monitor. Defaults to `false`.

alert_on_load_time_limit_2.description: Set this value to true, if you want to receive alerts if your server response is slower than load_time_limit_2. Shows a red status in performance monitor. Defaults to `false`.

alert_on_max_bytes.description: Enable this option if you want to check that the response of the Server not exceed `max_bytes` of bytes. Defaults to `false`

alert_on_max_element_bytes.description: Enable this option if you want to check that any element on your page not exceeds `max_element_bytes` of bytes. Defaults to `false`

alert_on_min_bytes.description: Enable this option if you want to check that the response of the Server contains at least `min_bytes` of bytes. Defaults to `false`

alert_on_percentage_fail.description: Enable this option if you want the time-, size-, or content-checks to generate alerts.

auth_type.description: Specify the username of the appropriate credentials here. Defaults to `None`.

block_google_analytics.description: Enable this option if outgoing monitoring requests should block google analytics.

block_uptrends_rum.description: Enable this option if outgoing monitoring requests should block uptrends rum.

block_urls.description: Set Urls which should be blocked by outgoing monitoring requests.

browser_type.description: The Type of Browser used to Load the Website. Allowed values are `Chrome`, `Firefox`, `IE`, `PhantomJS`, `PhantomJS20` and `Safari`. Defaults to `Chrome`.

check_interval.description: Numeric value for the time interval between individual checks, in minutes. The maximum value is 240 (4 hours). The minimum value depends on the type of monitor. Defaults to `5`.

failed_object_percentage.description: Specify a percentage treshold on which your want to get alerted 0% will report all element load failures

generate_alert.description: When set to false, no alerts will be generated for this monitor in case of an error. Defaults to `true`.

ignore_external_elements.description: Enable this option if you don't want to include external elements in any error condition that are related to download size.

is_active.description: Indicates whether the monitor is actively running in the account. Defaults to `true`.

is_locked.description: It specifies whether the monitor is currently locked for editing. This happens if the Support team is reviewing your monitor.

load_time_limit_1.description: Set threshold time in ms for requires `alert_on_load_time_limit_1` to be enabled. Defaults to `2500`.

load_time_limit_2.description: Set threshold time in ms for requires `alert_on_load_time_limit_2` to be enabled. Defaults to `5000`.

max_bytes.description: Set threshold bytes that the response of the Server must at least contains. Required `alert_on_max_bytes` to be enabled.

max_element_bytes.description: Set threshold bytes that the response of the Server must at least contains. Required `alert_on_max_element_bytes` to be enabled.

min_bytes.description: Set threshold bytes that the response of the Server must at least contains. Required `alert_on_min_bytes` to be enabled.

mode.description: The monitor mode, either Development, Staging or Production. Defaults to `Production`.

name.description: Display name for the Ping Monitor resource.

name_for_phone_alerts.description: The value for the speech-friendly monitor name, if applicable. This is the monitor name we’ll use in text-to-speech phone alerting, provided that the ‘Use alternate monitor names’ option has been enabled in the phone alert integration.

password.description: See the Username field. Specify the corresponding password value here.

primary_checkpoints_only.description: Only set this to False when you’re sure you want to execute your monitor on non-primary checkpoints. Defaults to `true`.

url.description: The full URL of the appropriate website, page or service that you want to monitor. The URL should include “http://” or “https://”. If relevant, please also include a port number if you are using a non-default port number, e.g. https://your-domain.com:8080/your-page. You can also use a fixed IP address as part of the URL instead of a host name, if your server listens to incoming requests without a host name.

user_agent.description: A string value that identifies which HTTP client is making the HTTP request. A browser typically sends a value that identifies the browser type and version.

username.description: Specify the username of the appropriate credentials here.

height.description: Set the height for resolution size.

mobile_device.description: Define the mobile device if `is_mobile` set to true.

pixel_ratio.description: The device pixel ratio is the ratio between physical pixels and logical pixels.

width.description: Set the width for resolution size.

is_positive.description: Set this value to `true` if you want to verify that your web page contains `pattern`. Set to false if you want to verify that your web page does not contain that text.

pattern.description: Insert a word or phrase if you want to verify that your web page contains that text.

name.description: Specify an HTTP header name used by your requests.

value.description: Specify an HTTP header value used by your requests.

checkpoints.description: A checkpoint is a geographic location from which you can have your service uptime and performance checked periodically. Provide checkpoint ids or names.

exclude_locations.description: It is possible to keep an entire region of checkpoints (e.g. Canada) selected (with the benefit of automatically getting new checkpoints as they are added to that region) but have additional control over individual checkpoint locations that you want to skip. Provide checkpoint ids or names.

regions.description: A Region contains one or more checkpoints, just define a region if all checkpoints in a region should be used. Provide region id or name.

description.description: Set an descriptive name for the Monitor Group resource.

is_all.description: Indicates whether this group is the `All Monitors` system group.

alert_on_load_time_limit_2.description: Set this value to true, if you want to receive alerts if your server response is slower than load_time_limit_2. Shows a red status in performance monitor. Defaults to `false`.

generate_alert.description: When set to false, no alerts will be generated for this monitor in case of an error. Defaults to `true`.

ip_version.description: IpV4 or IpV6. Indicates which IP version should be used to connect to the server or network address you specify. If you choose IPv6, the monitor will only be executed on checkpoint locations that support IPv6. Defaults to `IpV4`.

is_locked.description: It specifies whether the monitor is currently locked for editing. This happens if the Support team is reviewing your monitor.

load_time_limit_2.description: Set threshold time in ms for requires `alert_on_load_time_limit_2` to be enabled. Defaults to `5000`.

mode.description: The monitor mode, either Development, Staging or Production. Defaults to `Production`.

name.description: Display name for the Ping Monitor resource.

name_for_phone_alerts.description: The value for the speech-friendly monitor name, if applicable. This is the monitor name we’ll use in text-to-speech phone alerting, provided that the ‘Use alternate monitor names’ option has been enabled in the phone alert integration.

native_ipv6_only.description: True or False. This setting only applies when you select IpV6 for the IpVersion field. Set this value to true to only execute your monitor on checkpoint servers that support native IPv6 connectivity. Defaults to `false`.

network_address.description: The network address that should be used to connect to the server or service you want to monitor.

port.description: The TCP Port for the connect Monitor. Only used by connect Monitor, has to be between `1` and `65535`.

primary_checkpoints_only.description: Only set this to False when you’re sure you want to execute your monitor on non-primary checkpoints. Defaults to `true`.

type.description: Select between `Ping` and `Connect` monitor type. Defaults to `Ping`

block.description: Manages an Uptrends Ping and Connect Monitor.

alert_on_load_time_limit_1.description: Set this value to true, if you want to receive alerts if your server response is slower than load_time_limit_1 threshold. Shows a yellow status in performance monitor. Defaults to `false`.

alert_on_load_time_limit_2.description: Set this value to true, if you want to receive alerts if your server response is slower than load_time_limit_2. Shows a red status in performance monitor. Defaults to `false`.

alert_on_min_bytes.description: Enable this option if you want to check that the response of the Server contains at least `min_bytes` of bytes. Defaults to `false`

auth_type.description: Specify the username of the appropriate credentials here. Defaults to `None`.

check_cert_errors.description: An HTTPS check will only pass our checks if the SSL certificate does not cause any errors. Only set this option to `false` if you really want to ignore SSL certificate issues. This parameter takes only effect if `type` has been set to `Https`.

check_interval.description: Numeric value for the time interval between individual checks, in minutes. The maximum value is 240 (4 hours). The minimum value depends on the type of monitor. Defaults to `5`.

expected_http_status_code.description: Check for specific HTTP status code, any other than the specified status code, will generate an error.

generate_alert.description: When set to false, no alerts will be generated for this monitor in case of an error. Defaults to `true`.

http_method.description: Specifies the HTTP methode for your monitor. Defaults to `GET`.

ip_version.description: IpV4 or IpV6. Indicates which IP version should be used to connect to the server or network address you specify. If you choose IPv6, the monitor will only be executed on checkpoint locations that support IPv6. Defaults to `IpV4`.

is_active.description: Indicates whether the monitor is actively running in the account. Defaults to `true`.

is_locked.description: It specifies whether the monitor is currently locked for editing. This happens if the Support team is reviewing your monitor.

load_time_limit_2.description: Set threshold time in ms for requires `alert_on_load_time_limit_2` to be enabled. Defaults to `5000`.

min_bytes.description: Set threshold bytes that the response of the Server must at least contains. Required `alert_on_min_bytes` to be enabled.

mode.description: The monitor mode, either Development, Staging or Production. Defaults to `Production`.

name.description: Display name for the Ping Monitor resource.

name_for_phone_alerts.description: The value for the speech-friendly monitor name, if applicable. This is the monitor name we’ll use in text-to-speech phone alerting, provided that the ‘Use alternate monitor names’ option has been enabled in the phone alert integration.

native_ipv6_only.description: True or False. This setting only applies when you select IpV6 for the IpVersion field. Set this value to true to only execute your monitor on checkpoint servers that support native IPv6 connectivity. Defaults to `false`.

password.description: See the Username field. Specify the corresponding password value here.

primary_checkpoints_only.description: Only set this to False when you’re sure you want to execute your monitor on non-primary checkpoints. Defaults to `true`.

request_body.description:
When posting a form, fill in the form variables, every form variable has to be on separated line e.g. `foo=bar
bar=foo
`. Requires `http_method` to be set to `Post`.

type.description: Select between `Http`, `Https`, `WebserviceHttp` and `WebserviceHttps` monitor type. Defaults to `Http`

url.description: The full URL of the appropriate website, page or service that you want to monitor. The URL should include “http://” or “https://”. If relevant, please also include a port number if you are using a non-default port number, e.g. https://your-domain.com:8080/your-page. You can also use a fixed IP address as part of the URL instead of a host name, if your server listens to incoming requests without a host name.

user_agent.description: A string value that identifies which HTTP client is making the HTTP request. A browser typically sends a value that identifies the browser type and version.

username.description: Specify the username of the appropriate credentials here.

is_positive.description: Set this value to `true` if you want to verify that your web page contains `pattern`. Set to false if you want to verify that your web page does not contain that text.

pattern.description: Insert a word or phrase if you want to verify that your web page contains that text.

name.description: Specify an HTTP header name used by your requests.

value.description: Specify an HTTP header value used by your requests.

checkpoints.description: A checkpoint is a geographic location from which you can have your service uptime and performance checked periodically. Provide checkpoint ids or names.

exclude_locations.description: It is possible to keep an entire region of checkpoints (e.g. Canada) selected (with the benefit of automatically getting new checkpoints as they are added to that region) but have additional control over individual checkpoint locations that you want to skip. Provide checkpoint ids or names.

regions.description: A Region contains one or more checkpoints, just define a region if all checkpoints in a region should be used. Provide region id or name.

block.description: Manages Uptrends HTTP, HTTPS, Webservice HTTP and Webservice HTTPS Monitor.

allow_native_login.description: Should native login be enabled on the uptrends ui?

allow_single_signon.description: Should single signon be enabled on the uptrends ui?

backup_email.description: Set the backup email of the operator account owner.

culture_name.description: Set the locale which should be used for language, date/time and number.

default_dashboard.description: Specify the dashboard that will be displayed after login.

email.description: Set the email of the operator account owner.

full_name.description: Set the full name of the operator account owner.

is_account_admin.description: Indicates whether the operator is account administrator or not.

is_on_duty.description: Set to true if this account should be on-duty.

mobile_phone.description: Specify the mobile number of the Operator Account owner. Has to start with (+) followed by country code.

outgoing_phone_number_id.description: Define the ID for outgoing phone number which should be used by Phone provider.

password.description: Specify the corresponding password value here.

sms_provider.description: Define the sms provider that will be used sending alerts.

time_zone_id.description: Define the ID for timezone which should be used for this account.

use_numeric_sender.description: Define if the sms sender should be numeric.
